title: Bay to Bay News
text:
Photobomber A bird photobombs this spring foal in a photo Jerry Hull took on May 6 in west Dover.

Vroom! Edward Sidel took this action shot at the Dover Days parade.

Sunset on the water Kenneth Bowen, of Dover, captured this sunset scene on May 7 at the sunset at the Lewes and Rehoboth Canal.

Celebrating Dover Days Beth Petit de Mange enjoyed the kick-off fireworks for Dover Days on May 2 at Legislative Hall.

Blue-quet This west Dover Blue Jay may not be able to get a large bouquet of flowers for his loved one, but a simple small arrangement can convey love and appreciation, writes photographer Jerry Hull.

Snowy day Patricia Sterling, of Wyoming, photographed this beautiful Snowy Egret at Bombay Hook National Wildlife Refuge in April..

Wingman Alex Cisar spotted this Great Egret with a Heron for wingman in April at Bombay Hook Wildlife Refuge.

Fountain drink Paul Roth spotted a goldfinch drinking from fountain on May 6 in a Lewes garden.

Dover Days dazzle Jitka Ellis of Dover captured the Dover Days fireworks bursting over Legislative Hall.

Goose parade Tom Wilkerson enjoyed this parade of geese on May 2 at Silver Lake Park, Dover.

Fishin' Jerry Hull photographed this Great blue heron chasing minnows in a pond at Byler's Store in west Dover in early May..

Swinging hummingbird Patricia Sterling, of Wyoming, captured this male hummingbird enjoying his swing in Wyoming. .

In bloom Valerie Hankins of Harrington took this image of an iris in bloom west of Harrington on May7.

Lewes lillies Richard L. Bryan, of Lewes, likes the looks of these lillies in Lewes..

Osprey's catch Bill Eastburn of Lincoln took this photo of an Osprey holding his catch along Slaughter Beach Road in May.

Eagle at Bombay Hook Dan Laughman of Magnolia snapped this photo of a Bald Eagle in flight at Bombay Hook National Wildlife Refuge on April 24.

Big gulp Dan Laughman, of Magnolia, watched this Great Blue Heron down a very large fish was taken at Bombay Hook National Wildlife Refuge on April 24.

Splash of blue Jerry Hull captioned this photo "Just a Splash of Blue Will Do." The scene was taken April 25 in west Dover.

Eagle along Kitts Hummock .Gary Knox says he spotted this immature bald eagle sitting in a field off Kitts Hummock Road in Dover on April 26..

Approaching storm "All is quiet along the Leipsic River as thunderstorms threaten the charming little town of Leipsic as the storms follow the Bay," writes Jerry Hull of his April 27 photo.

Lewes at dusk Richard L Bryan, of Lewes, enjoyed dusk at the Lewes Boatyard.

First of season Jerry Hull, of Dover, captured this ruby-throated hummingbird making his first visit to a backyard feeder on April 26.

'Timing is everything' "Timing is everything when trying to photograph this ruby-throated hummingbird visiting our feeder in west Dover," says Jerry Hull.

Garter snake Richard Bryan of Lewes snapped this photo of a garter snake enjoying the sunshine.

Goose walk A gosling walks, spotted by Jerry Hull, walks near a small pond in west Dover.

Beautiful blooms Beth Petit de Mange of Dover enjoyed this scene from the Lewes Tulip Festival time. The beautiful gardens were created and maintained by Lewes In Bloom volunteers.

Welcome back Stephanie Burton, of Felton, welcomed a hummingbird to her yard on April 22.

Looking up Brad Richardson of Dover enjoyed this unique perspective of the trees at Blackbird State Forest.

Welcome to Dover Lee Mullarkey, of Dover, snapped this terrific tulip photo on April 21.
